com.company

Class RequestHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.company.RequestHandler

  • public class RequestHandler
extends java.lang.Object
    Makes a new request and sends it with the given method , body , and other settings which has been set up by user ; So it handles a request and has control over it . It also has the ability to print the response and headers , upload binary files , saving requests and response bodies with the help of FileUtils class .

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      RequestHandler(java.lang.String[] split)
      Makes a new request by getting the input line array of strings .
      RequestHandler(java.net.URL url, java.lang.String method, java.lang.String messageBodyStr, java.util.ArrayList<java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String>> headers, boolean hasBody)
      This constructor that uses params is used when "jurl fire" is entered and we want to send some requests again .

      Downloads an image from an specific address and saves it into a file in downloads directory .

    • Constructor Detail

      • RequestHandler

        public RequestHandler(java.lang.String[] split)
               throws java.net.MalformedURLException
        Makes a new request by getting the input line array of strings . Checks all the possible errors that is not observed by user and prints error (not exceptions , because we want the program to be continued . Expect in emergency errors that the program should be stopped . ) After making a request wth checking some special circumstances , sends the request and prints the response .
        Parameters:
        split - String[] split , Input split by space bars
        Throws:
        java.net.MalformedURLException - Handled in Main class .

      • RequestHandler

        public RequestHandler(java.net.URL url,
                      java.lang.String method,
                      java.lang.String messageBodyStr,
                      java.util.ArrayList<java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String>> headers,
                      boolean hasBody)
        This constructor that uses params is used when "jurl fire" is entered and we want to send some requests again .
        Parameters:
        url - URL , url of request
        method - String , method of request
        messageBodyStr - String , request's body
        headers - ArrayList> , all headers of request
        hasBody - boolean , true if it has a body and false , if it hasn't

    • Method Detail

      • doRequest

        public void doRequest()
        Handles a request and does all that should be done in send a request which is sending a request and printing the response . Patch method is checked separately because it is handled with different library .

      • fireRequest

        public void fireRequest()
        Acts like doRequest method but it is only used when "jurl fire" is entered and to fire requests .

      • setHeaders

        public void setHeaders(java.lang.String headersStr)
        Gets a string of all headers and set al of them into a 2d dimensional arrayList of strings .
        Parameters:
        headersStr - String , string of all headers

      • send

        public void send()
        Makes a new connection , opens it and sends the request . Check all the conditions and call the specific method for each of them , also sets the method and headers .

      • sendPatch

        public void sendPatch(java.lang.String urlString,
                      java.lang.String messageBodyStr)
        Sends patch method , it is implemented in a different method because the library used for this method is different .

      • printPatchResponse

        req - HttpUriRequest

      • printResponse

        public void printResponse()
        Prints the response of the request , and if -i is entered prints the headers .

        Returns:
        boolean , true if the type is png/image , false if it isn't .

      • bufferOutFormData

                              throws java.io.IOException

      • toFollowRedirect

        public boolean toFollowRedirect()
        When errors in range of 300 are happened , this method helps us to check if we have to follow redirect or now . (This is checked when -f is entered by user )
        Returns:
        boolean , true if follow redirect should be done and false , if tis the opposite .

      • followRedirect

        public void followRedirect()
        Does the redirecting and gets the request to the address which gives code 200 (OK) .
